Object-Oriented Design & Patterns [1/36]

Cay S. Horstmann

Chapter 9

Multithreading

Chapter Topics [2/36]

  • Thread Basics
  • Thread Synchronization
  • Animations

Threads [3/36]

  • Thread: program unit that is executed independently
  • Multiple threads run simultaneously
  • Virtual machine executes each thread for short time slice
  • Thread scheduler activates, deactivates threads
  • Illusion of threads running in parallel
  • Multiprocessor computers: threads actually run in parallel

Running Threads [4/36]

  • Define class that implements Runnable
  • Runnable has one method
    void run()
  • Place thread action into run method
  • Construct object of runnable class
  • Construct thread from that object
  • Start thread

Running Threads [5/36] 

public class MyRunnable implements Runnable
{
   public void run()
   {
      thread action
   }
}
...
Runnable r = new MyRunnable();
Thread t = new Thread(t);
t.start();

Thread Example [6/36]

  • Run two threads in parallel
  • Each thread prints 10 greetings
    for (int i = 1; i <= 10; i++)
    {
       System.out.println(i + ": " + greeting);
       Thread.sleep(100);
    }
  • After each printout, sleep for 100 millisec
  • All threads should occasionally yield control
  • sleep throws InterruptedException

Thread Example [7/36]

file:horstmann/ch09_greeting/GreetingProducer.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_greeting;
00002: /**
00003:    An action that repeatedly prints a greeting.
00004: */
00005: public class GreetingProducer implements Runnable
00006: {
00007:    /**
00008:       Constructs the producer object.
00009:       @param aGreeting the greeting to display
00010:    */
00011:    public GreetingProducer(String aGreeting)
00012:    {
00013:       greeting = aGreeting;
00014:    }
00015: 
00016:    public void run()
00017:    {
00018:       try 
00019:       {
00020:          for (int i = 1; i <= REPETITIONS; i++)
00021:          {
00022:             System.out.println(i + ": " + greeting);
00023:             Thread.sleep(DELAY);                     
00024:          }
00025:       }
00026:       catch (InterruptedException exception)
00027:       {
00028:       }
00029:    }
00030: 
00031:    private String greeting;
00032: 
00033:    private static final int REPETITIONS = 10;
00034:    private static final int DELAY = 100;
00035: }
00036:

file:horstmann/ch09_greeting/ThreadTester.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_greeting;
00002: /**
00003:    This program runs two threads in parallel.
00004: */
00005: public class ThreadTester
00006: {
00007:    public static void main(String[] args)
00008:    {
00009:       Runnable r1 = new GreetingProducer("Hello, World!");
00010:       Runnable r2 = new GreetingProducer("Goodbye, World!");
00011:       
00012:       Thread t1 = new Thread(r1);
00013:       Thread t2 = new Thread(r2);
00014: 
00015:       t1.start();
00016:       t2.start();
00017:    }
00018: }
00019:

  • Note: output not exactly interleaved
1: Hello, World! 
1: Goodbye, World! 
2: Hello, World! 
2: Goodbye, World! 
3: Hello, World! 
3: Goodbye, World! 
4: Hello, World! 
4: Goodbye, World! 
5: Hello, World! 
5: Goodbye, World! 
6: Hello, World! 
6: Goodbye, World! 
7: Hello, World! 
7: Goodbye, World! 
8: Goodbye, World! 
8: Hello, World! 
9: Goodbye, World! 
9: Hello, World! 
10: Goodbye, World! 
10: Hello, World!

Starting Two Threads [9/36]



Thread States [10/36]

  • Each thread has
    • thread state
    • priority
  • Thread states:
    • new (before start called)
    • runnable
    • blocked
    • dead (after run method exits)

Thread States [11/36]


Blocked Thread State [12/36]

  • Reasons for blocked state:
    • Sleeping
    • Waiting for I/O
    • Waiting to acquire lock (later)
    • Waiting for condition (later)
  • Unblocks only if reason for block goes away

Scheduling Threads [13/36]

  • Scheduler activates new thread if
    • a thread has completed its time slice
    • a thread has blocked itself
    • a thread with higher priority has become runnable
  • Scheduler determines new thread to run
    • looks only at runnable threads
    • picks one with max priority

Terminating Threads [14/36]

  • Thread terminates when run exits
  • Sometimes necessary to terminate running thread
  • Don't use deprecated stop method
  • Interrupt thread by calling interrupt
  • Calling t.interrupt() doesn't actually interrupt t; just sets a flag
  • Interrupted thread must sense interruption and exit its run method
  • Interrupted thread has chance to clean up

Sensing Interruptions [15/36]

  • Thread could occasionally call
    Thread.currentThread().isInterrupted()
  • sleep, wait throw InterruptedException when thread interrupted
  • . . . and then the interruption status is cleared!
  • More robust: Sleep occasionally, catch exception and react to interruption
  • Recommendation: Terminate run when sensing interruption

Sensing Interruptions [16/36] 

public class MyRunnable implements Runnable
{
   public void run()
   {
      try
      {
         while (...)
         {
            do work            
            Thread.sleep(...);
         }      
      }
      catch (InterruptedException e) {}
      clean up
   }
}

Thread Synchronization [17/36]

  • Use bounded queue from chapter 3
  • Each producer thread inserts greetings
  • Each consumer thread removes greetings
  • Two producers, one consumer

Producer Thread [18/36] 

int i = 1; 
while (i <= greetingCount) 
{ 
   if (!queue.isFull()) 
   { 
      queue.add(i + ": " + greeting); 
      i++; 
   } 
   Thread.sleep((int)(Math.random() * DELAY)); 
}

Consumer Thread [19/36] 

int i = 1; 
while (i <= greetingCount) 
{ 
   if (!queue.isEmpty()) 
   { 
      Object greeting = queue.remove(); 
      System.out.println(greeting); 
      i++; 
   } 
   Thread.sleep((int)(Math.random() * DELAY)); 
}

Expected Program Output [20/36] 

1: Hello, World! 
1: Goodbye, World! 
2: Hello, World! 
3: Hello, World! 
... 
99: Goodbye, World! 
100: Goodbye, World!

Why is Output Corrupted? [21/36]

  • Sometimes program gets stuck and doesn't complete
  • Can see problem better when turning debugging on
    queue.setDebug(true);

file:horstmann/ch09_queue1/ThreadTester.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_queue1;
00002: /**
00003:    This program runs two threads in parallel.
00004: */
00005: public class ThreadTester
00006: {
00007:    public static void main(String[] args)
00008:    {
00009:       BoundedQueue<String> queue = new BoundedQueue<String>(10);
00010:       queue.setDebug(true);
00011:       final int GREETING_COUNT = 100;
00012:       Runnable run1 = new Producer("Hello, World!", 
00013:             queue, GREETING_COUNT);
00014:       Runnable run2 = new Producer("Goodbye, World!", 
00015:             queue, GREETING_COUNT);
00016:       Runnable run3 = new Consumer(queue, 2 * GREETING_COUNT);
00017:       
00018:       Thread thread1 = new Thread(run1);
00019:       Thread thread2 = new Thread(run2);
00020:       Thread thread3 = new Thread(run3);
00021: 
00022:       thread1.start();
00023:       thread2.start();
00024:       thread3.start();
00025:    }
00026: }
00027: 
00028:

file:horstmann/ch09_queue1/Producer.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_queue1;
00002: /**
00003:    An action that repeatedly inserts a greeting into a queue.
00004: */
00005: public class Producer implements Runnable
00006: {
00007:    /**
00008:       Constructs the producer object.
00009:       @param aGreeting the greating to insert into a queue
00010:       @param aQueue the queue into which to insert greetings
00011:       @param count the number of greetings to produce
00012:    */
00013:    public Producer(String aGreeting, BoundedQueue<String> aQueue, int count)
00014:    {
00015:       greeting = aGreeting;
00016:       queue = aQueue;
00017:       greetingCount = count;
00018:   }
00019: 
00020:    public void run()
00021:    {
00022:       try
00023:       {
00024:          int i = 1;
00025:          while (i <= greetingCount)
00026:          {
00027:             if (!queue.isFull())
00028:             {
00029:                queue.add(i + ": " + greeting);
00030:                i++;
00031:             }
00032:             Thread.sleep((int) (Math.random() * DELAY));         
00033:          }
00034:       }
00035:       catch (InterruptedException exception)
00036:       {
00037:       }
00038:    }
00039: 
00040:    private String greeting;
00041:    private BoundedQueue<String> queue;
00042:    private int greetingCount;
00043: 
00044:    private static final int DELAY = 10;
00045: }
00046:

file:horstmann/ch09_queue1/Consumer.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_queue1;
00002: /**
00003:    An action that repeatedly removes a greeting from a queue.
00004: */
00005: public class Consumer implements Runnable
00006: {
00007:    /**
00008:       Constructs the consumer object.
00009:       @param aQueue the queue from which to retrieve greetings
00010:       @param count the number of greetings to consume
00011:    */
00012:    public Consumer(BoundedQueue<String> aQueue, int count)
00013:    {
00014:       queue = aQueue;
00015:       greetingCount = count;
00016:    }
00017: 
00018:    public void run()
00019:    {
00020:       try
00021:       {
00022:          int i = 1;
00023:          while (i <= greetingCount)
00024:          {
00025:             if (!queue.isEmpty())
00026:             {
00027:                String greeting = queue.remove();
00028:                System.out.println(greeting);
00029:                i++;
00030:             }
00031:             Thread.sleep((int)(Math.random() * DELAY));
00032:          }
00033:       }
00034:       catch (InterruptedException exception)
00035:       {
00036:       }
00037:    }
00038: 
00039:    private BoundedQueue<String> queue;
00040:    private int greetingCount;
00041: 
00042:    private static final int DELAY = 10;
00043: }
00044:

file:horstmann/ch09_queue1/BoundedQueue.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_queue1;
00002: import java.util.ArrayList;
00003: /** 
00004:     A first-in, first-out bounded collection of objects. 
00005: */ 
00006: public class BoundedQueue<E>
00007: { 
00008:    /** 
00009:        Constructs an empty queue. 
00010:        @param capacity the maximum capacity of the queue 
00011:    */ 
00012:    public BoundedQueue(int capacity) 
00013:    { 
00014:       elements = new ArrayList<E>(capacity); 
00015:       head = 0; 
00016:       tail = 0; 
00017:       size = 0;
00018:    } 
00019: 
00020:    /** 
00021:        Removes the object at the head. 
00022:        @return the object that has been removed from the queue
00023:        @precondition !isEmpty()
00024:    */ 
00025:    public E remove() 
00026:    { 
00027:       if (debug) System.out.print("removeFirst");
00028:       E r = elements.get(head); 
00029:       if (debug) System.out.print(".");
00030:       head++;
00031:       if (debug) System.out.print(".");
00032:       size--;
00033:       if (head == elements.size()) 
00034:       {
00035:          if (debug) System.out.print(".");
00036:          head = 0; 
00037:       }
00038:       if (debug) 
00039:          System.out.println("head=" + head + ",tail=" + tail 
00040:             + ",size=" + size);
00041:       return r; 
00042:    } 
00043: 
00044:    /** 
00045:        Appends an object at the tail. 
00046:        @param newValue the object to be appended 
00047:        @precondition !isFull();
00048:    */ 
00049:    public void add(E newValue) 
00050:    { 
00051:       if (debug) System.out.print("add");
00052:       elements.set(tail,newValue); 
00053:       if (debug) System.out.print(".");
00054:       tail++;
00055:       if (debug) System.out.print(".");
00056:       size++;
00057:       if (tail == elements.size()) 
00058:       {
00059:          if (debug) System.out.print(".");
00060:          tail = 0; 
00061:       }
00062:       if (debug) 
00063:          System.out.println("head=" + head + ",tail=" + tail 
00064:             + ",size=" + size);
00065:    } 
00066: 
00067:    public boolean isFull() 
00068:    { 
00069:      return size == elements.size();
00070:    } 
00071: 
00072:    public boolean isEmpty() 
00073:    { 
00074:       return size == 0; 
00075:    } 
00076: 
00077:    public void setDebug(boolean newValue)
00078:    {
00079:       debug = newValue;
00080:    }
00081: 
00082:    private ArrayList<E> elements; 
00083:    private int head; 
00084:    private int tail; 
00085:    private int size;
00086:    private boolean debug;
00087: }
00088:

Race Condition Scenario [22/36]

  • First thread calls add and executes
    elements[tail] = anObject;
  • First thread at end of time slice
  • Second thread calls add and executes
    elements[tail] = anObject;
    tail++;
  • Second thread at end of time slice
  • First thread executes
    tail++;

Race Condition Scenario [23/36]


Locks [24/36]

  • Thread can acquire lock
  • When another thread tries to acquire same lock, it blocks
  • When first thread releases lock, other thread is unblocked and tries again
  • Two kinds of locks
    • Objects of class implementing java.util.concurrent.Lock interface type, usually ReentrantLock
    • Locks that are built into every Java object

Reentrant Locks [25/36] 

aLock = new ReentrantLock();
. . .
aLock.lock();
try
{
   protected code
}
finally
{
   aLock.unlock();
}

Scenario with Locks [26/36]

  1. First thread calls add and acquires lock, then executes
    elements[tail] = anObject;
  2. Second thread calls add and tries to acquire lock, but it is blocked
  3. First thread executes
    tail++;
  4. First thread completes add, releases lock
  5. Second thread unblocked
  6. Second thread acquires lock, starts executing protected code

Deadlocks [27/36]

  • Not enough to synchronize add, remove
  • if (!queue.isFull()) queue.add(...);  
    can still be interrupted
  • Must move test inside add method
    public void add(E newValue)
    {
       queueLock.lock();
       try
       {
          while (queue is full)
             wait for more space
          . . .
       }
       finally { qeueLock.unlock(); }
    }
  • Problem: nobody else can call remove

Avoiding Deadlocks [28/36]

  • Use condiiton object to manage "space available" condition
    private Lock queueLock = new ReentrantLock();
    private Condition spaceAvailableCondition
       = queueLock.newCondition();
  • Call await when condition is not fulfilled:
    public void add(E newValue)
    {
       . . .
       while (size == elements.length)
          spaceAvailableCondition.await();
       . . .
    }

Avoiding Deadlocks [29/36]

  • Waiting thread is blocked
  • Condition object manages set of threads that wait for the condition to change
  • To unblock, another thread must call signalAll on the same condition object
  • Call when state changes
    public E remove()
    {
       . . .
       E r = elements[head];
       . . .
       spaceAvailableCondition.signalAll(); // Unblock waiting threads
       return r;
    }
  • All waiting threads removed from wait set, unblocked

file:horstmann/ch09_queue2/BoundedQueue.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_queue2;
00002: import java.util.concurrent.locks.*;
00003: import java.util.ArrayList;
00004: 
00005: /** 
00006:     A first-in, first-out bounded collection of objects. 
00007: */ 
00008: public class BoundedQueue<E>
00009: { 
00010:    /** 
00011:        Constructs an empty queue. 
00012:        @param capacity the maximum capacity of the queue 
00013:    */ 
00014:    public BoundedQueue(int capacity) 
00015:    { 
00016:       elements = new ArrayList<E>(capacity); 
00017:       head = 0; 
00018:       tail = 0; 
00019:       size = 0;
00020:    } 
00021: 
00022:    /** 
00023:        Removes the object at the head. 
00024:        @return the object that has been removed from the queue
00025:    */ 
00026:    public E remove() throws InterruptedException
00027:    { 
00028:       queueLock.lock();
00029:       try
00030:       {         
00031:          while (size == 0) 
00032:             valueAvailableCondition.await();
00033:          E r = elements.get(head); 
00034:          head++;
00035:          size--;
00036:          if (head == elements.size()) 
00037:             head = 0; 
00038:          spaceAvailableCondition.signalAll();
00039:          return r; 
00040:       }
00041:       finally
00042:       {
00043:          queueLock.unlock();
00044:       }
00045:    } 
00046: 
00047:    /** 
00048:        Appends an object at the tail. 
00049:        @param newValue the object to be appended 
00050:    */ 
00051:    public void add(E newValue) throws InterruptedException
00052:    { 
00053:       queueLock.lock();
00054:       try
00055:       {         
00056:          while (size == elements.size()) 
00057:             spaceAvailableCondition.await();
00058:          elements.set(tail,newValue); 
00059:          tail++;
00060:          size++;
00061:          if (tail == elements.size()) 
00062:             tail = 0; 
00063:          valueAvailableCondition.signalAll();
00064:       }
00065:       finally
00066:       {
00067:          queueLock.unlock();
00068:       }
00069:    } 
00070: 
00071:    private ArrayList<E> elements; 
00072:    private int head; 
00073:    private int tail; 
00074:    private int size;
00075: 
00076:    private Lock queueLock = new ReentrantLock();
00077:    private Condition spaceAvailableCondition 
00078:          = queueLock.newCondition();
00079:    private Condition valueAvailableCondition 
00080:          = queueLock.newCondition();
00081: }
00082:

Object Locks [30/36]

  • Each object has a lock
  • Calling a synchronized method acquires lock of implicit parameter
  • Leaving the synchronized method releases lock
  • Easier than explicit Lock objects
    public class BoundedQueue<E>
    {
       public synchronized void add(E newValue) { . . . }
       public synchronized E remove() { . . . }
       . . .
    }

Object Locks [31/36]

  • Each implicit lock has one associated (anonymous) condition object
  • Object.wait blocks current thread and adds it to wait set
  • Object.notifyAll unblocks waiting threads 
    public synchronized void add(E newValue)
       throws InterruptedException
    {
       while (size == elements.length) wait();
       elements[tail] = anObject;
       . . .
       notifyAll(); // notifies threads waiting to remove elements
    }

file:horstmann/ch09_queue3/BoundedQueue.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_queue3;
00002: import java.util.ArrayList;
00003: /** 
00004:     A first-in, first-out bounded collection of objects. 
00005: */ 
00006: public class BoundedQueue<E>
00007: { 
00008:    /** 
00009:        Constructs an empty queue. 
00010:        @param capacity the maximum capacity of the queue 
00011:    */ 
00012:    public BoundedQueue(int capacity) 
00013:    { 
00014:       elements = new ArrayList<E>(capacity); 
00015:       head = 0; 
00016:       tail = 0; 
00017:       size = 0;
00018:    } 
00019: 
00020:    /** 
00021:        Removes the object at the head. 
00022:        @return the object that has been removed from the queue
00023:    */ 
00024:    public synchronized E remove() 
00025:          throws InterruptedException
00026:    { 
00027:       while (size == 0) wait();
00028:       E r = elements.get(head); 
00029:       head++;
00030:       size--;
00031:       if (head == elements.size()) 
00032:          head = 0; 
00033:       notifyAll();
00034:       return r; 
00035:    } 
00036: 
00037:    /** 
00038:        Appends an object at the tail. 
00039:        @param newValue the object to be appended 
00040:    */ 
00041:    public synchronized void add(E newValue) 
00042:          throws InterruptedException
00043:    { 
00044:       while (size == elements.size()) wait();
00045:       elements.set(tail,newValue); 
00046:       tail++;
00047:       size++;
00048:       if (tail == elements.size()) 
00049:          tail = 0; 
00050:       notifyAll();
00051:    } 
00052: 
00053:    private ArrayList<E> elements; 
00054:    private int head; 
00055:    private int tail; 
00056:    private int size;
00057: }
00058:

Visualizing Locks [32/36]

  • Object = phone booth
  • Thread = person
  • Locked object = closed booth
  • Blocked thread = person waiting for booth to open

Visualizing Locks [33/36]



Algorithm Animation [34/36]

  • Use thread to make progress in algorithm
  • Display algorithm state
  • Example: Animate the Sorter below
  • Sleeps inside compare method
  • Pass custom comparator
    Comparator<Double> comp = new
       Comparator<Double>()
       {
          public void compare(Double d1, Double d2)
          {
             sleep
             return comparison result
          }
       };

file:horstmann/ch09_animation1/Sorter.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_animation1;
00002: import java.util.*;
00003: 
00004: /**
00005:    This runnable executes a sort algorithm.
00006:    When two elements are compared, the algorithm
00007:    pauses and updates a panel.
00008: */
00009: public class Sorter implements Runnable
00010: {
00011:    /**
00012:       Constructs the sorter.
00013:       @param values the array to sort
00014:       @param panel the panel for displaying the array
00015:    */
00016:    public Sorter(Double[] values, ArrayComponent panel)
00017:    {
00018:       this.values = values;
00019:       this.panel = panel;
00020:    }
00021: 
00022:    public void run()
00023:    {
00024:       Comparator<Double> comp = new
00025:          Comparator<Double>()
00026:          {
00027:             public int compare(Double d1, Double d2)
00028:             {
00029:                panel.setValues(values, d1, d2);
00030:                try
00031:                {
00032:                   Thread.sleep(DELAY);
00033:                }
00034:                catch (InterruptedException exception)
00035:                {
00036:                   Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
00037:                }
00038:                return (d1).compareTo(d2);
00039:             }
00040:          };
00041:       MergeSorter.sort(values, comp);
00042:       panel.setValues(values, null, null);
00043:    }
00044: 
00045:    private Double[] values;
00046:    private ArrayComponent panel;
00047:    private static final int DELAY = 100;
00048: }
00049:

Algorithm Animation [35/36]


file:horstmann/ch09_animation1/ArrayComponent.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_animation1;
00002: import java.awt.*;
00003: import java.awt.geom.*;
00004: import javax.swing.*;
00005: 
00006: /**
00007:    This component draws an array and marks two elements in the
00008:    array.
00009: */
00010: public class ArrayComponent extends JComponent
00011: {
00012:    public synchronized void paintComponent(Graphics g)
00013:    {
00014:       if (values == null) return;
00015:       Graphics2D g2 = (Graphics2D) g;
00016:       int width = getWidth() / values.length;
00017:       for (int i = 0; i < values.length; i++)
00018:       {
00019:          Double v =  values[i];
00020:          Rectangle2D bar = new Rectangle2D.Double(
00021:             width * i, 0, width, v);
00022:          if (v == marked1 || v == marked2)
00023:             g2.fill(bar);
00024:          else
00025:             g2.draw(bar);
00026:       }
00027:    }
00028: 
00029:    /**
00030:       Sets the values to be painted.
00031:       @param values the array of values to display
00032:       @param marked1 the first marked element
00033:       @param marked2 the second marked element
00034:    */
00035:    public synchronized void setValues(Double[] values,
00036:       Double marked1, Double marked2)
00037:    {
00038:       this.values = (Double[]) values.clone();
00039:       this.marked1 = marked1;
00040:       this.marked2 = marked2;
00041:       repaint();
00042:    }
00043: 
00044:    private Double[] values;
00045:    private Double marked1;
00046:    private Double marked2;
00047: }
00048:

file:horstmann/ch09_animation1/AnimationTester.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_animation1;
00002: import java.awt.*;
00003: import javax.swing.*;
00004: 
00005: /**
00006:    This program animates a sort algorithm.
00007: */
00008: public class AnimationTester
00009: {
00010:    public static void main(String[] args)
00011:    {
00012:       JFrame frame = new JFrame();
00013:       frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
00014: 
00015:       ArrayComponent panel = new ArrayComponent();
00016:       frame.add(panel, BorderLayout.CENTER);
00017: 
00018:       frame.setSize(FRAME_WIDTH, FRAME_HEIGHT);
00019:       frame.setVisible(true);
00020: 
00021:       Double[] values = new Double[VALUES_LENGTH];
00022:       for (int i = 0; i < values.length; i++)
00023:          values[i] = Math.random() * panel.getHeight();
00024: 
00025:       Runnable r = new Sorter(values, panel);
00026:       Thread t = new Thread(r);
00027:       t.start();
00028:    }
00029: 
00030:    private static final int VALUES_LENGTH = 30;
00031:    private static final int FRAME_WIDTH = 300;
00032:    private static final int FRAME_HEIGHT = 300;
00033: }
00034:

Pausing and Running the Animation [36/36]

  • Want to pause animation until "Run" or "Step" button is clicked
  • Need to coordinate UI thread, animation thread
  • Try to use built-in thread-safe construct in java.util.concurrent
  • Trick: Use a blocking queue
  • Button click adds string "Run" or "Step" to queue
  • Animation thread calls take on the queue, blocks if no string inserted

file:horstmann/ch09_animation2/Sorter.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_animation2;
00002: import java.util.*;
00003: import java.util.concurrent.*;
00004: 
00005: /**
00006:    This runnable executes a sort algorithm.
00007:    When two elements are compared, the algorithm
00008:    pauses and updates a panel.
00009: */
00010: public class Sorter implements Runnable
00011: {
00012:    public Sorter(Double[] values, ArrayComponent panel, BlockingQueue<String> queue)
00013:    {
00014:       this.values = values;
00015:       this.panel = panel;
00016:       this.queue = queue;
00017:    }
00018: 
00019:    public void run()
00020:    {
00021:       Comparator<Double> comp = new
00022:          Comparator<Double>()
00023:          {
00024:             public int compare(Double d1, Double d2)
00025:             {
00026:                try
00027:                {
00028:                   String command = queue.take();
00029:                   if (command.equals("Run"))
00030:                   {
00031:                      Thread.sleep(DELAY);
00032:                      if (!"Step".equals(queue.peek()))
00033:                         queue.add("Run");
00034:                   }
00035:                }
00036:                catch (InterruptedException exception)
00037:                {
00038:                   Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
00039:                }
00040:                panel.setValues(values, d1, d2);
00041:                return d1.compareTo(d2);
00042:             }
00043:          };
00044:       MergeSorter.sort(values, comp);
00045:       panel.setValues(values, null, null);
00046:    }
00047: 
00048:    private Double[] values;
00049:    private ArrayComponent panel;
00050:    private BlockingQueue<String> queue;
00051:    private static final int DELAY = 100;
00052: }
00053:

file:horstmann/ch09_animation2/AnimationTester.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package horstmann.ch09_animation2;
00002: import java.awt.*;
00003: import java.awt.event.*;
00004: import javax.swing.*;
00005: import java.util.concurrent.*;
00006: 
00007: /**
00008:    This program animates a sort algorithm.
00009: */
00010: public class AnimationTester
00011: {
00012:    public static void main(String[] args)
00013:    {
00014:       JFrame frame = new JFrame();
00015:       frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
00016: 
00017:       ArrayComponent panel = new ArrayComponent();
00018:       frame.add(panel, BorderLayout.CENTER);
00019: 
00020:       JButton stepButton = new JButton("Step");
00021:       final JButton runButton = new JButton("Run");
00022: 
00023:       JPanel buttons = new JPanel();
00024:       buttons.add(stepButton);
00025:       buttons.add(runButton);
00026:       frame.add(buttons, BorderLayout.NORTH);
00027:       frame.setSize(FRAME_WIDTH, FRAME_HEIGHT);
00028:       frame.setVisible(true);
00029: 
00030:       Double[] values = new Double[VALUES_LENGTH];
00031:       for (int i = 0; i < values.length; i++)
00032:          values[i] = Math.random() * panel.getHeight();
00033: 
00034:       final BlockingQueue<String> queue = new LinkedBlockingQueue<String>();
00035:       queue.add("Step");
00036: 
00037:       final Sorter sorter = new Sorter(values, panel, queue);
00038: 
00039:       stepButton.addActionListener(new
00040:          ActionListener()
00041:          {
00042:             public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent event)
00043:             {
00044:                queue.add("Step");
00045:                runButton.setEnabled(true);
00046:             }
00047:          });
00048: 
00049:       runButton.addActionListener(new
00050:          ActionListener()
00051:          {
00052:             public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent event)
00053:             {
00054:                runButton.setEnabled(false);
00055:                queue.add("Run");
00056:             }
00057:          });
00058: 
00059:       Thread sorterThread = new Thread(sorter);
00060:       sorterThread.start();
00061:    }
00062: 
00063:    private static final int FRAME_WIDTH = 300;
00064:    private static final int FRAME_HEIGHT = 300;
00065:    private static final int VALUES_LENGTH = 30;
00066: }
00067:
